column23: Frage
column52: FrageEnglisch

column23: Haben Sie regelmäßige Kontakte zu anderen Mitarbeitenden im Unternehmen?

column52: Do you have regular contacts to other people in the company?

column52: Do you contact your colleagues just in case they have a special issue?

column52: Do you have the feeling to be socially accepted?

column52: Do you have social events in your company - like company dinner, trips or events?

column52: The colaboration…between younger and older empolyees is…

column52: between leaders and followers is…

column23: zwischen Frauen und Männern ist…
column52: between women and men is…

column52: between academics and non-academics is…

column52: between production and administration is…

column23: zwischen Forschung und Entwicklung und Produktion ist…
column52: between research&development and production

column23: Gibt es Ihrer Einschätzung nach in Ihrem Unternehmen mehr Gerüchte als üblich?
column52: Do you think, there are more rumors than usual in your company?

column23: Wie würden sie den Umgangston in Ihrem Unternehmen beschreiben?
column52: How would you describe the ‚conversation sound‘ / the casual conversation within your company?

column23: Wie schnell sind wichtige Informationen über grundsätzliche Entscheidungen bei Ihnen vor Ort? (Top to bottom)
column52: How fast is important information on general decisions on your desk?  (Top to bottom)

column23: Ist die Kommunikation in Ihrem Unternehmen offen, nachvollziehbar und bindend?
column52: Is the communication in your company open, stringent and binding?

column52: Do you have high-quality face to face communication in your company that help you to understand how and why decisions and choices have been made?

column52: Are you allowed to contact your manager with concerns or other important issues?

column52: Are the doors to the senior managers open for everybody?

column23: Machen Sie häufig Gebrauch davon, d.h. nutzen Sie die ‚offene Tür‘?
column52: Do you use the ‚open door‘ opportunity frequently?

column52: Do you have enough Information to make a decision?

column23: Wie viele hierarchische Ebenen gibt es oberhalb Ihrer Position im Unternehmen?
column52: How is the number of hierarchical levels above your position within the company?

column23: Welchen Stellenwert hat in Ihrem Unternehmen die Selbstabstimmung innerhalb von Teams?
column52: Which status or significance has self-determination in teams?

column52: Does external control predominate in your organisation?

column52: How is the degree of freedom to make a decision?

column52: What is the importance of improvisation and flexibility as regards to the continuance of working procedures?

column52: Do you feel controlled by this feedback?

column23: Sehen Sie diese Rückmeldung als Zeichen der Anerkennung durch Ihre Führungskraft?
column52: Do you receive this feedback as a sign of attention/interest in you?

column23: Tendiert Ihr Unternehmen zu Kontrolle oder zu Honorierung (muss nicht finanziell sein)?
column52: Does your company tend to control or to reward? (must not be financial)

column52: Do you see equal mutual reconciliation within teams?

column52: Do you think you have a fair share on the success of the company?

column52: Do you think that performance is dealt justly in your organization?

column52: Do you feel like the working atmosphere is characterized by frankness/fair mildness?

column52: Are words and doings / actions consistent everywhere?

column23: Sind Entscheidungen in Ihrem Unternehmen nachvollziehbar und reflektiert, d.h. nicht willkürlich?
column52: Are decisions in your company traceable and not arbitrary?

column23: Sind nachvollziehbare und klare Gründe erkennbar, warum Entscheidungen gefällt werden?
column52: Are there clear reasons why things happen?

column52: Do people in your organization do what they commit?

column23: Wenn Sie Ihre Ziele nicht erreichen, gehen Sie damit offen und transparent um, statt die Sachlage zu verfälschen und abzuwarten?
column52: If you don't meet your targets, do you tell people honestly without fudging the issue before you ‘run against the wall’?

column23: Sind vertrauliche Informationen sicher in Ihrem Unternehmen?
column52: Is confident information safe in your company?

column23: Vertrauen Sie darauf, dass die eigene Verletzbarkeit nicht ausgenutzt wird?
column52: Do you trust that the own vulnerability will not be capitalized / exploited?

column52: Do you feel safe to admit failure?

column52: Is everyone treated as an equal partner, including people in the back office, facility managers, purchasers and sales people?

column52: Does your impression of the company culture make you believe that your best interest is taken at heart?

column52: Is this sentence true ’I trust that my manager is going to make the right decision’?
